channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Housing Market “Stuck” Until 2026 as Insurance Prices Rise, Rents Slow
item.description: See Dave, Henry, James, and Kathy at BPCon2024 in Cancún, Mexico! Grab your ticket here! The housing market is “stuck” and may stay that way for the next two years. […]

item.title: Data breach exposes millions of mSpy spyware customers
item.description: A huge batch of mSpy customer service emails dating back to 2014 were stolen in a May data breach. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Jackson, Mississippi, Wants Curfew Centers to Cut Crime. Here’s What Other Cities Learned.
item.description: After a teen’s murder, city officials hope a curfew and youth centers will get kids off the street. Young people are skeptical.

item.title: These 11 Markets Used to Be America’s Hot Spots. Now They’ve Gone Cold.
item.description: The pandemic-fueled explosion of growth has waned, and now these real estate hot spots have gotten icy.

item.title: Shark Tank-backed Kudos raises another $3M for healthier, cotton-based disposable diapers
item.description: Kudos founder says her company makes a disposable diaper lined with 100% cotton, unlike the major competitors. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Love Beyond Bars: Miguel and Silvia
item.description: While Miguel Solorio did 25 years for a crime he didn’t commit, his wife, Silvia, was right by his side. Here’s their California love story in pictures.

item.title: Homebuying Reality Check: College Graduates Can Still Succeed
item.description: In an environment of high rates, high prices, and low wage growth, can new college graduates really succeed with real estate?

item.title: ‘Wild Wild Space’ doc captures the risks and rivalries of the new space race
item.description: Astra CEO Chris Kemp is already pulling out of a parking spot when he warns the person in the passenger seat that he doesn’t have a valid driver’s license. “And the car’s not registered, and they canceled my insurance,” he says. “This is a little risky.” So opens “Wild Wild Space,” a new HBO documentary […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Crime Rates and the 2024 Election: What You Need to Know
item.description: As crime data again becomes a flashpoint in the presidential campaign, experts push for better national statistics.

item.title: My Rental Burned Down! What I Wish I Knew Before It Happened
item.description: You get a call one day from the fire department, telling you, “You’ve had a house fire that’s destroyed your rental property.” What do you do first? Check on the […]

item.title: ‘Visual’ AI models might not see anything at all
item.description: Although these companies' claims are artfully couched, it's clear that they want to express that the model sees in some sense of the word. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Death Row Prisoner’s Parting Interview
item.description: Days before his scheduled execution in Texas, Ramiro Gonzales speaks on faith, legacy — and apologizing to the family of his victim, Bridget Townsend.

item.title: Are Tiny Homes a Good Investment? How a $50,000 Home Pencils Out
item.description: Are tiny homes a good investment? For just $50,000, you can get a brand new tiny home investment—not even fifteen percent of the average single-family home price in the United […]

item.title: Lucid revs up sales, Fisker makes a deal and Uber reignites an old fight
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation. Sign up here for free — just click TechCrunch Mobility! Did you miss us last week? Even with a relatively quiet week due to the July 4 holiday, there were some notable goings-on. To no one’s surprise, […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The New Battle Over an Old Institution: Forced Prison Labor
item.description: Inside the latest legal and legislative efforts to close state constitutional loopholes that allow slavery as punishment for a crime.
